Data Class Reference

This class contains and manages the data. More...

#include <data.h>

Public Types

enum  ScaleMode { RAW = 1, MAX = 2, SHOULDER = 3 }
 String indicating in scale mode the user is using (raw, scale by the maximum, scale by the shoulder) in the correlationView.

Classes

class  ClusterInfo
 Represents information on a cluster: the index of the first spike of a given cluster number in spikesByCluster the number of spikes of the cluster and optionnally information added by the user: the structure where the cluster is located the type of the unit the isolation distance the quality notes.
class  Correlation
 Represents correlation data for a pair of clusters.
class  CorrelationsInProcess
 This class stores the information to know which cluster has correlations in process.
class  CorrelogramIterator
 Specialized iterator on the latest correlation data stored by a request of a correlationTread for a given pair of clusters. More...
class  Iterator
 Specialized iterator which iterate on the features contained in features for the cluster specified in the constructor. More...
class  SampleWaveformIterator
 Returns an iterator on the latest waveform data stored by a request of a waveformTread for a given cluster. More...
class  TimeFrameWaveformIterator
 Returns an iterator on the latest waveform data stored by a request of a waveformTread for a given cluster. More...
class  WaveformData
 Represents waveform data for a cluster.
class  WaveformIterator
 This class a wrapper to waveform information (spikes, mean value and standard deviation). More...
class  Waveforms
 Represents waveform data for a cluster: This class is the purely virtual parent.
class  WaveformStatus

Detailed Description

This class contains and manages the data.

Author:
Lynn Hazan

void Data::minMaxDimensionCalculation ( QValueList< int >  modifiedClusters  ) 

Calculate the minimum and maximum for each dimension and store them in dimensionMinima and dimensionMaxima respectively.

Parameters:
modifiedClusters list of the clusters which have been modified implying the modification of the cluster 0 this the recalculation of the minima and maxima.

dataType Data::createNewCluster ( QRegion &  region,
const QValueList< int > &  clustersOfOrigin,
int  dimensionX,
int  dimensionY,
QValueList< int > &  fromClusters,
QValueList< int > &  emptyClusters 
)

Creates a new cluster out of existing ones.

Parameters:
region the polygon defining the area containing the spikes for the new cluster.
clustersOfOrigin a list of the cluster numbers identifying the clusters which may contain spikes in the region
dimensionX the dimension used as absciss to display the clusters
dimensionY the dimension used as ordinate to display the clusters
fromClusters an empty list used as a return value, which will be filled with the cluster numbers which really contained spikes in the region
emptyClusters an empty list used as a return value, which will be filled with the cluster numbers which became empty because all their spikes were put in the new one.
Returns:
the number of the newly created cluster or 0 if no cluster have been created (no spikes selected). This is safe as cluster 0 (artifact) can never be created that way.

QMap< int, int > Data::createNewClusters ( QRegion &  region,
const QValueList< int > &  clustersOfOrigin,
int  dimensionX,
int  dimensionY,
QValueList< int > &  emptyClusters 
)

Creates a new clusters out of existing ones.

If the polygon of selection contains x clusters x new clusters will be created.

Parameters:
region the polygon defining the area containing the spikes for the new cluster.
clustersOfOrigin a list of the cluster numbers identifying the clusters which may contain spikes in the region
dimensionX the dimension used as absciss to display the clusters
dimensionY the dimension used as ordinate to display the clusters
emptyClusters an empty list used as a return value, which will be filled with the cluster numbers which became empty because all their spikes were put in the new one.
Returns:
a map where the keys are ids of the clusters which really contained spikes in the region and the values are the ids of the newly created clusters.

void Data::deleteSpikesFromClusters ( QRegion &  region,
const QValueList< int > &  clustersOfOrigin,
int  destinationCluster,
int  dimensionX,
int  dimensionY,
QValueList< int > &  fromClusters,
QValueList< int > &  emptyClusters 
)

Removes spikes from some clusters and assign them to the cluster destinationCluster which is either the cluster 0, corresponding to the artifact, or the cluster 1, corresponding to the noise.

Parameters:
region the polygon defining the area containing the spikes corresponding to the noise.
clustersOfOrigin a list of the cluster numbers (in ascending order) identifying the clusters which may contain spikes in the region
destinationCluster the cluster number to assign the spikes contained in the region
fromClusters an empty list used as a return value, which will be filled with the cluster numbers which really contained spikes in the region
dimensionX the dimension used as absciss to display the clusters
dimensionY the dimension used as ordinate to display the clusters
emptyClusters an empty list used as a return value, which will be filled with the cluster numbers which became empty because all their spikes were put in the new one.

void Data::moveClustersToNoise ( QValueList< int > &  clustersToDelete  ) 

Deletes the clusters contained in clustersToDelete.

The correponding spikes are assign to cluster 1 (the noise)

Parameters:
clustersToDelete a list of the cluster numbers (in ascending order) identifying the clusters to delete.

void Data::moveClustersToArtefact ( QValueList< int > &  clustersToDelete  ) 

Deletes the clusters contained in clustersToDelete.

The correponding spikes are assign to cluster 0 (the artifact)

Parameters:
clustersToDelete a list of the cluster numbers (in ascending order) identifying the clusters to delete.

dataType Data::groupClusters ( QValueList< int > &  clustersToGroup  ) 

Groups the clusters contained in clustersToGroup.

The correponding spikes are assign to a new cluster. The user information of the different clusters to be grouped will be concatenated.

Parameters:
clustersToGroup a list of the cluster numbers (in ascending order) identifying the clusters to group
Returns:
the number of the newly created cluster.

Parameters:

Parameters:

int Data::nbOfSampleInWaveform (  )  const [inline]

Returns the number of points used to describe a waveform.

Each point correspond to a diffrent instant in time.

bool Data::isRecordingTwoBytes (  )  [inline]

Gives information on how the data were recorded.

True if the data where recording using a 12 or 16 bits recording system which gives data coded on 2 bytes, false otherwise, (the recording is then assume to be 32 bits and then the data are coded on 4 bytes).

bool Data::spikePositions ( int  clusterId,
SortableTable &  subsetTable 
)

Gets a onr row SortableTable with the spike positions for the cluster clusterId.

Parameters:
clusterId d of the cluster for which the spike position are search.
subsetTable the array where the result of the search will be store.
Returns:
true if the cluster exist and the data have been retreive, false otherwise.

int Data::nbPtsBySpike (  )  [inline]

Returns the number of points corresponding to a spike.

This equals to: nbChannels * nbSamplesInWaveform

QString  structure,
QString  type,
QString  ID,
QString  quality,
QString  notes 
) [inline]

Assignes to the cluster the information given by the user.

Parameters:
clusterId id of the cluster for which the information are given.
structure structure in which the cluster is supposed to be.
type type of the cluster.
ID Isolation distance of the cluster.
quality quality of the cluster.
notes notes of any type on the cluster.

void Data::getUserClusterInformation ( int  clusterId,
vector< QString > &  clusterInformation 
) [inline]

Gest the cluster the information given by the user.

Parameters:
clusterId id of the cluster for which the information are given.
Returns:
array of QString containing the following information (in the following order) : structure in which the cluster is supposed to be. type of the cluster. Isolation distance of the cluster. quality of the cluster. notes of any type on the cluster.

QMap< int, ClusterUserInformation > &  clusterUserInformationMap 
) const

Gets the map of cluster user information.

Parameters:
pGroup the current electrod group id.
clusterUserInformationMap map given the cluster user information, the key is the cluster id and the value an instance of ClusterUserInformation.

QFile &  fetFile 
)

Creates the feature file to automatically recluster the clusters contained in clustersToRecluster.

bool Data::integrateReclusteredClusters ( QValueList< int > &  clustersToRecluster,
QValueList< int > &  reclusteredClusterList,
FILE *  clusterFile 
)

Integrates the clusters obtained by automatic reclustering.

Suppress the reclustered ones and add the newly created ones.

Parameters:
clustersToRecluster list of clusters reclustered.
reclusteredClusterList output parameter, the list of the newly created clusters. The list will be empty if the integration is not successful.
clusterFile cluster file created by the automatic reclustering program.
Returns:
true if the integration is successful, false otherwise.

bool Data::isTraceViewVariablesAvailable (  )  const [inline]

Informs if the the variables need it by the traceView are available.

Those variables are retrieve only from the parameter file in xml format (the new for

Returns:
true if the variables are available, false otherwise.

SampleWaveformIterator* Data::sampleWaveformIterator ( dataType  clusterId,
dataType  nbSampleSpikes 
) [inline]

Creates and returns an sampleWaveformIterator on the spikes of the given cluster with the specified nbSampleSpikes number of spikes.

This iterator iterates on the spikes selected for the sample mode presentation of the waveforms. In that mode, only a sample of the spikes evenly distributed on all the recording are available.

Parameters:
clusterId the number of the cluster on which spikes the iterator will iterates.
nbSampleSpikes number of spikes selected for the sample mode presentation.
Returns:
the sampleWaveformIterator on the spikes of the given cluster.

TimeFrameWaveformIterator* Data::timeFrameWaveformIterator ( dataType  clusterId,
dataType  startTime,
dataType  endTime 
) [inline]

Creates and returns an TimeFrameWaveformIterator on the spikes of the given cluster.

This iterator iterates on the spikes selected for the time frame mode presentation of the waveforms. In that mode, all the spikes in a given time frame are available.

Parameters:
clusterId the number of the cluster on which spikes the iterator will iterates.
startTime starting time selected for the time frame mode.
endTime ending time selected for the time frame mode.
Returns:
the TimeFrameWaveformIterator on the spikes of the given cluster.

Data::Status Data::getCorrelograms ( Pair &  pair,
int  binSize,
int  timeWindow,
double  binSizeInRU,
float  timeWindowInRU,
int  halfBins 
)

Calculates the correlograms for each pair of clusters given in pairs.

Parameters:
pair pair of clusters for which a correlogram has to be compute.
binSize size of the bins to compute given in miliseconds.
timeWindow time frame use to compute the correlograms, given in miliseconds.
binSizeInRU size of the bins to compute given in recording units.
timeWindowInRU half of the time frame use to compute the correlograms, given in recording units.
halfBins the number of bins to compute are so there are a total of nBins = 1+2*halfBins bins (halfBins.5 for each halfTimeWindow).
Returns:
the status, READY if the data have already been calculated or the asked computation is finish, and IN_PROCESS if an other thread is already treating the pairs the thread has to do.

CorrelogramIterator Data::correlogramIterator ( Pair  pair,
ScaleMode  scale,
int  binSize,
int  timeframe 
) [inline]

Creates and returns an iterator on the correlogram data of the given pair of clusters (pair).

Parameters:
pair the pair of clusters on which correlogram data the iterator will iterates.
scale the scale to applied to the correlogram's data (maximum value, shoulder value or no scale).
binSize size of the bin used to compute the correlogram.
timeframe time frame used to compute the correlogram.
Returns:
the iterator on the correlogram data of the given pair.
